titleStmt.title: An ansvver to mis-led Doctor Fearne. According to his own method of his book [brace] Sect. 1. 2. The divinity being by Scripture Sect. 3. 4. 5. The reason by Aristotle Sect. 6. 7. The sense or matter of fact by witnesse [brace] examined.
titleStmt.author: Herle, Charles, 1598-1659.

titleStmt.title: An ansvver to mis-led Doctor Fearne. According to his own method of his book [brace] Sect. 1. 2. The divinity being by Scripture Sect. 3. 4. 5. The reason by Aristotle Sect. 6. 7. The sense or matter of fact by witnesse [brace] examined.
titleStmt.author: Herle, Charles, 1598-1659.

publicationStmt.date: Printed the second weeke of Ianuary. 1642. [i.e. 1643]

notesStmt.note: Attributed to Charles Herle by Wing.
A reply to: Ferne, H. The resolving of conscience, upon this question.
The words "Sect. 1. 2. .. by witnesse" are enclosed in brackets on title page.
Annotation on Thomason copy: "Jan: 10th at London".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
